loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 17 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new clothes to sell, which will help Juliet generate greater profits and improve the family's stardand of living. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger boutique. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have five children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the farm's production. She wishes to invest the resulting farming profits in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a Juhudi Kilimo customer. She is a farmer living in Kitale, and she is married with three children. She has been farming for 10 years. She produces and sells milk, as well as maize, beans, groundnuts, and kale (referred to as sukuma wiki in East Africa), which is grown mostly in the area. In farming, she loves growing and harvesting her maize, beans and groundnuts because they give her good business. The challenge she faces is that of weeding and irrigating her sukuma wiki field.

Dorcas chose Juhudi Kilimo because she saw her friends benefit from their loans. She decided to give Juhudi Kilimo a try, and she has not regretted her decision. Juhudi Kilimo's loan repayment plan is achievable. This loan will enable her expand her dairy farm. She will also acquire a large farming field which will lead to more food production for both selling and family consumption. The income acquired is intended to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Som Oul

texts.en: From a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Som Oul is a 31-year-old farmer and a married woman with three children. She also works as a paid laborer in order to earn additional income to cater the needs of her family. Her husband shares his responsibilities to financially support the household by working as a driver for a construction company. Every day he transports construction materials from place to place by orders from the clients. This couple is seeking ways of improving their income and aiming to start their own business of providing transportation service to clients who order construction materials. To make this dream a reality, Som Oul decided to borrow a loan in the sum of 1,500 USD to buy a motorcycle and trailer, which will enable her husband to start providing transportation service. In the future, Som Oul wishes to run a general store from her house and hopes to make a consistent income to secure the overall needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and trailer, which will enable her husband to start providing transportation service.

loans.name: Jean D’Amour

texts.en:
Jean D'Amour is 33 years old. He is a father of three and they all go to school. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers for rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. He was very thankful for the previous loan, which he used to obtain more returns from rice production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor and fertilizers for his rice farm.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Peace has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential food stuffs. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities to sell and will help Peace to generate greater profits and have enough money to raise her child. Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house of her own. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and is a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities to sell.

loans.name: Angelica Del Carmen

texts.es: Angélica de 56 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad. Angélica es una mujer emprendedora quien con mucho esfuerzo se gana la vida y busca las formas de llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir tales como faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Además vende productos de belleza en diferentes zonas de su localidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de incrementar el inventario de productos de belleza para poder cubrir y satisfacer a un mayor número de clientes. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cremas, lociones, desodorantes, champo, tintes para cabello, etc. Confía que de esta forma logrará mejorar su situación económica y podrá dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Angélica is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their 18-year-old son. Angélica is an enterprising woman, who with a great deal of effort, earns a living and looks for ways of supporting her household. 

She makes articles of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. In addition, she sells beauty products in various areas of her town. With the aim of improving her income, she has made the decision to increase her inventory of beauty products, so that she can cover and satisfy a greater number of customers. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of creams, lotions, deodorants, shampoo, hair tints, etc. She is confident that in this way, she will succeed in improving her financial situation and be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, deodorants, shampoo, hair tints, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married father of two children who has been working in selling silver, stainless steel, and Brazilian gold accessories for thirteen years.
He is is family's sole breadwinner and his business is his only source for living since his wife doesn't work. He has to make sure that he is capable of covering almost all of his family's needs.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his store's stock of newly released Brazilian gold to get ready for the coming Holy Christmas preparations and to ensure his customers will have a wide variety of items to choose what they like. This is his fourth loan cycle with Al Majmoua with a good standing repayment history. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business through increasing his business capital with special items that attracted customers' attention. Ali hopes to continue developing his business to move to a wider shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase his store's stock of newly released Brazilian gold to prepare for the coming Holy Christmas preparations.

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia is a 45-year-old married father of four children who has been working as a car electrician for 31 years. He started working early to support his parents in their living. He reached intermediate education and wished he had the chance to continue, but his parents' financial situation forced him to forget his childhood needs and seek what was more important for living.

In 2000, he started working at his current workshop. He is developing it as much as he can since he has a very good reputation in his domain and region. Yehia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy special needed items for car electric systems, machines that are very important to respond quickly to any customer request or problem.

He hopes to keep expanding his business in a well-managed way to make sure that he can respond to his family's increasing educational and living needs.

loans.use: To buy special needed items for car electric systems, machines that are very important to reply quickly to any customer request or problem

loans.name: Sidoeung's Group

texts.en:
Sidoeung is 42 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Svay Reang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband sells grilled eggs. He makes an income of $5 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $5 per day. 

This is the second loan for Sidoeung’s group with KREDIT. She is now leading her group in requesting a loan. As leader, she is going to purchase a water filter to use in her family home. This purchase will help her improve her family’s health, preventing diarrhea and other diseases which are caused by unclean water. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she wants to improve the house’s condition and make it bigger.

Note: Saman and Savuth were not available for the picture, but their wives are in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to use in her family home

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
This is Clara. She previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Clara would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Clara dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that she will also grow spiritually. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Uziel

texts.en:
Uziel is 34 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase rice production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 48 years old. She is married with three children. She has spent more than ten years in rice farming. She would like to use a Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors to enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Meet Anthony, a faithful Juhudi Kilimo customer, who took out a loan last year to purchase a dairy cow and repaid it successfully. He would like a second loan to purchase poultry. He wishes to expand his farm, where he produces and sells milk, and has crops such as maize and vegetables. He has farmed  for 10 years. Anthony is married and has four children. He really enjoys what he does, especially planting food crops. The main challenge he faces in farming is the long rains which affect his crops. Anthony chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they finance farming activities and also help farmers grow. He has also benefited from another Juhudi Kilimo loan. This loan will help him to pay his children's school fees and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 27-year-old married man with two children who are nine and three years old. They are living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Stephen's main business is retail, in addition to selling cows in order to boost his income. 

Stephen is facing a challenge of limited capital and the general price fluctuations of essential commodities. However, he has a vision of constructing rentals to earn extra income. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise for his retail business.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise for the business.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vannesa está estudiando la carrera de medicina, es una estudiante que se está esforzando por poder sobresalir y ser una de las mejores.
Comenta que su anhelo es poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud, y está siempre ha sido la carrera que queria estudiar.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir sus gastos de la universidad, ya que la carrera que está siguiendo es una de las más caras. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Vanessa is studying for a degree in Medicine. She is a student who strives for success and to become one of the best. Vanessa says that her wish is to help other people with something important, such as health. Medicine has always been the field that she wanted to study.

She is requesting this loan so that she can cover her university expenses. Her degree program continues to be one of the most expensive. Vanessa is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay for her university expenses.

loans.name: Leiver

texts.es: Leiver tiene un edad de 28 años, es padre soltero de una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Su actividad  es el taller de mecánica y soldadura,  se dedica al negocio por espacio de 5 años, se inicia  gracias a la demanda insatisfecha y dentro de la cuadra no existía un negocio similar por lo cual decidió iniciar su propio negocio, hoy en día cuenta con buena aceptación en  el mercado, además se dedica al servicio de transpórtate urbano interno con motokar propio que  le permitiendo  mejorar su calidad de vida y cubrir todas sus necesidades básica de su canasta familiar. Leiver espera seguir creciendo con su negocio y uno de sus sueños es contar con una taller completo y variado.Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece de antemano el apoyo económico recibido y promete ser puntual con sus pagos. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina soldadora.
texts.en:
Leiver is 28 years old and the single father of a daughter, with whom he lives in their own home. His business is an auto repair and welding workshop. He has had his business for five years, starting it thanks to unsatisfied demand and the fact that no similar business existed on their street. So he decided to start his own business. 

Now he has good acceptance in the market, and also provides urban transportation with a mototaxi, which is allowing him to improve his quality of life and cover all his household's basic needs. 

Leiver hopes to continue growing his business, and one of his dreams is to have a complete, well-equipped workshop.

This is his first loan with Kiva. He is grateful in advance for the financial support received, and promises to be on time with his payments. The money requested is 1500 soles and he will invest it in the purchase of a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es: Xiomara de 24 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 4 años y 5 meses de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que su querida familia cuente con buenas condiciones por lo que día con día se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Xiomara se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas quesadillas las cuales con mucho amor prepara en su horno artesanal que con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir junto a su esposo. Desea incrementar la oferta de quesadillas puesto que cada día sus clientes le demandan más y muchas veces no logra satisfacer la demanda. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: queso, arroz, azúcar, crema, manteca, moldes, etc. para la elaboración de más quesadillas para la venta.
texts.en: Xiomara, who is 24 years old, lives in her own house along with her life companion and their children, ages 4 ad 5 months. For her, the most important thing is that her beloved family have good [living] conditions, and so she exerts herself day after day to bring sustenance to her home. Xiomara makes and sells delicious quesadillas, which she prepares with much love in her artisanal oven, which she and her husband managed to construct with great effort. She wants to expand her offerings of quesadillas, since every day her customers demand more, and many times she can't manage to satisfy the demand. She is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of necessary supplies such as cheese, rice, sugar, cream, lard, baking pans, etc., to prepare more quesadillas to sell.

loans.use: to buy cheese, rice, sugar, cream, lard, baking pans, etc.

loans.name: Juan Nelson

texts.es: Juan de 46 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Juan se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, azúcar, arroz, papel, golosinas, etc. con mucho esfuerzo logró establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Desea mejoras sus ingresos ya que de ello dependen él  y su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de productos de tienda tales como: azúcar, leche, golosinas, arroz, aceite, macarrones, etc. Para incrementar su inventario y de esta forma poder satisfacer una mayor demanda de mercado y así lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. Juan sells basic household necessities such as: cooking oil, sugar, rice, toilet paper, candy, etc. With a great deal of effort, he has succeeded in setting up a small store in his home, which is his main source of income. 

He wishes to improve his income, as he and his family rely on it. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of products such as: sugar, milk, candy, rice, cooking oil, noodles, etc. This is to increase his inventory to satisfy greater market demand, and this way manage to improve quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, candy, rice, cooking oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en: Yeoun, aged 35, is an experienced farmer from a rural village in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province. She lives with her husband and child in their own home. With the help of her husband, Yeoun is engaged in the cultivation of rice, yams and other seasonal crops. In each harvest season, local traders always come to the village to buy agricultural products from local villagers. Agribusiness is the sole source of the family's income. Since she doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. Therefore she has requested a loan of US$560 to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Yeoun to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy related necessities.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en: Zaza, age 33, is from Batumi city. He is married and the father of four sons. His family has a small monthly income from their stationery store, which Zaza runs. He also offers printing service to his customers from his store. Zaza has been in this business for nearly a year and works as a salesperson himself. In order to generate income for his family's well being, Zaza plans to enlarge his business. He is requesting a loan to buy stock such as notebooks, pens, papers, rulers and other stationery items for resale. A part of the loan will be used for purchasing cartridge powder for printing. Zaza hopes that a Kiva loan will be helpful for his business and he will increase his income. Zaza and his family members hope to improve their standard of living in future.

loans.use: to buy stationery items for resale and printer cartridge powder.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en: Rith, aged 25, is a local farmer and resident from the Baray district of Kampong Thom province. She is married, but she doesn’t have a child yet; she hopes to have one soon. Rith, aside from farming chores, is involved in a travelling sales business selling beds and rattan products. Rith has been in this business for seven years and earns an average income of KHR 40,000 per day. To help her further develop her business, she would like to acquire a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 as working capital to buy rattan products and beds to resell. This loan will enable her to sustain her business and make a consistent income for her family. Rith and her family rely heavily on the goodwill of the lenders and thanks them for their support.

loans.use: to buy rattan products and beds to resell.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Met is 45 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Svay Reang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 per day. All of her children are employed as either garment or construction workers; they earn about $9 per day. This is the second loan for Met’s group with KREDIT. She is now leading her group to request a loan. As a leader, she is going to purchase a water filter to use at home. This purchase will help her improve her family’s health by preventing diarrhea and other diseases which come from unclean water. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a water filter to use at home.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Chacha, who is in his late twenties, is married with five children, three of whom are in school, while two are still young. 


For ten years now, Chacha has been involved with farming activities where he grows fruits and tomatoes; thereafter he sells them at wholesale to different business people. He is also involved with livestock (local cows). He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 


This will be his eleventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy pesticides for his farm fruits and vegetables and to pay farm laborers. With the previous loans, all of which he has paid in full, Chacha managed to buy ten cows, so as to extend his business portfolio, and bought more fruits from other farmers for selling. 


Chacha used his business profit to start building a house, and bought a home TV, sofa set, dining table and radio, and covered some school fees expenses. Family expenses and part of the school fees are covered by his wife, who is running other business projects in accordance with himself. 


Chacha is full of productive dreams, especially in the agriculture sector. He dreams to open a wholesale shop.


He will share this loan with his loan group, “Mshikamano", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his farm fruits and vegetables and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is hardworking woman. She is a poor woman from a small village in Tajikistan. She lives with her husband and three children. 

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than six years. Her husband and her son help her with managing the business. Munira fattens sheep. During a year, she sells her fattened sheep four or five times. She sells her sheep in a local market. 

Munira wants to repair her house, but she has not enough money. Her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc., for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc., for repairing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the items in his general store's inventory.

loans.name: Tabora Group

texts.en:
Frida, who is in her late 40s, is single with two children: one is still at school and the other one is grown up. She has been running a grocery store for four years now. She works from 8 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. She will use this loan to restock the missing items in the grocery store. She dreams of opening a bar.

This will be Frida's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase stock for the grocery store and also bought more drinks. She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses. She is doing great and is happy with the loan. She really appreciates all who have supported Tabora Group.

Frida will share this loan with her loan group, "Tabora", which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Dianne Diony

texts.es: Dioni agradece a los inversinoistas por el prestamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con el negocio de compra y venta de cámaras digitales, ella sigue viajando al país de  Bolivia para comprar mercadería y así poder abastecer y luego distribuye a sus clientes en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oortundiad requiere el prestamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cámaras digitales para así poder ofrecer a más clientes y de esta manera tener más ganancia.
texts.en:
Dioni thanks her lenders for the loan. She is happy to have their support. 

She continues with her business buying and selling digital cameras. She continues to travel to Bolivia to buy merchandise to supply and later distribute to her customers in the city of Cusco. 

She is now requesting a loan to buy more merchandise - digital cameras. 

This will enable her to offer her clients a better selection and will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as digital cameras.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of six grown children. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. 

Her husband catches the fish, and she sells them to earn a living. Anselma is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, fuel for the pump boat, and lead weights. 

With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, fuel for the pump boat, and lead weights.

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Iván en sus negocios de variedades de mercancías, venta de celulares, refrescos y venta de minutos. Su credikiva lo benefició porque con su inversión logró un mayor surtido, agregó mas capital de trabajo a su negocio, hubo mayor liquidez, y mejoraron sus utilidades paulatinamente.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará celulares accesorios para ellos, y paquetes especiales de minutos. Su inversión será exitosa, porque se enmarca en la demanda del mercado y al estar estratégicamente ubicado y  con mayor capital de trabajo bien invertido,impactará sus ventas y sus utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Iván is grateful for the support he received for his businesses that involve selling various merchandise, mobile phones, soft drinks, and phone minutes. His Kiva loan was beneficial because that investment resulted in more inventory. By adding more operating capital to his business, he achieved greater liquidity and gradually increased his profits.

At the moment, Iván is applying for a new loan that he will use to buy mobile phone accessories and special phone minute packages. This investment will be successful because there is more market demand and his business is strategically located. By having more operating capital, he will be able to have a good investment that will impact his sales and profits. This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful investment.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and special phone minute packages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: Fernando es originario de la ciudad de Nandaime, Carazo, casado y padre de tres hijos. De 51 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos. Inicio este negocio hace diez años, con el apoyo de su esposa y dinero propio, se pusieron de acuerdo para realizar el negocio. Visitaba negocio por negocio, hasta obtener sus clientes. Actualmente cuenta con mucha clientela y visita a nuevos puestos de negocio. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Solicita un crédito para comprar medicamentos como: amoxicilinas, panadol, acetaminofén, antimicinas, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con la alta demanda de sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le ayudara a tener un fuerte crecimiento y obtendrá mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir vendiendo para terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en: Fernando is originally from the city of Nandaime, Carazo. He is married and is the father of three children. He is 51 years old. He is a merchant who sells medications. He began this business 10 years ago, with the help of his wife and his own money. They were in agreement about setting up the business. He visited business after business to obtain his customers. Now he has many customers and he visits new places of business. His goal is to improve the conditions of his home. He is applying for a loan to buy medicines such as amoxicillin, Panadol, acetaminophen, and antimycins, among others, with the goal of meeting the high demands of his customers. He feels that this loan will help him to have strong growth and he will obtain better earnings. His plan for the future is to continue selling to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy medicines such as amoxicillin, Panadol, acetaminophen, and antimycins, among others

loans.name: Aliyah

texts.en:
Aliyah is a 56-year-old married mother of seven children who has been working in selling women's clothes since five years ago. In January 2010, she opened her current shop to develop her business and improve her family's living.


Aliyah is an important financial supporter to her family. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a newly released autumn and winter collection, especially before the Holy Christmas and New Year's celebrations.


This is her second experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan was invested in increasing her business capital, which reflected positively on her business development and her family's socioeconomic situation.


She hopes to keep on being capable of developing her business and responding to her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a newly released autumn and winter collection.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 37-year-old married woman who has been running her own business as a tailor since fourteen years ago. She started working at her current location in June 2008. She had to close her previous shop and start running her business from her house because they had to move to another village.
Zeinab got her tailoring experience from her mother, who used to be a well-known tailor, when she left school during her intermediate level and went into business life. She started her own business to help her husband increase their income and develop their livelihoods because of his low-income business.

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tailoring tools to develop her business. She is going to buy needles, threads and decorating tools. Zeinab is very optimistic about this loan, and she hopes that, through future requested loans, she'll be capable of reopening a separate tailoring shop outside her house which will attract new customers and provide privacy to her current and future customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary tailoring tools like needles, threads and decorating tools to develop her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
La señora Fátima se dedica a la venta de leche, ya que tiene dos vacas holandesas que producen 20 litros de leche por día que distribuye en  su barrio a lo cual se dedica hace 5 años. 
Gracias a esta actividad  ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto. Ella pide este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de leche para poder complementar y así seguir cumpliendo con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima sells milk. She has two Holstein cows that produce 20 liters of milk each day, which then get distributed throughout her neighborhood. Fátima has been in business for five years.

Thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead, maintain her household, and provide for any unexpected expense. Fátima is requesting this loan so that she can buy milk to supplement her inventory. This will enable her to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy additional milk to sell.

loans.name: Iroda

texts.en:
Iroda is a young and successful woman. She was born in the year 1990. She is widowed and has 2 children. She has been busy with growing crops and vegetables. She manages with this business alone. She is the only feeder and keeper of her 2 little children.

Iroda wants to develop a business and maximize profits. From the profits she is going to improve their living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new sowing season

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, age 31, is a farmer and resident of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. He has been working in the farming business for almost 15 years with the help of his wife. 


He cultivates rice and cassavas on a few pieces of parcel, from which he is able to make a daily income of KHR 11,000. Farming is the important source of income for his family. 


As this is a harvest season, he has applied for a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 to hire laborers to work on his cassava plantations. This will be his second loan cycle from HKL. 


He plans to reinvest the income he expects to generate from his current business back into planting cassavas, and to save for the future expansion of his business.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on his cassava plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of apparel and linens for resale

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es:
Don  Dimas de 66 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, es acompañado, su esposa trabaja cuidando la granja de las gallinas ponedoras que tienen. El primer hijo trabaja en la capital, la segunda  hija trabaja en la alcaldía municipal, el tercero  vive en Estados Unidos y el cuarto que actualmente está estudiando segundo año de Lic. En ciencias jurídicas.

Don Dimas, se dedica a la cría y explotación de aves ponedoras, también tiene un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas, donde elabora puertas, ventanas, etc.  Tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la explotación de aves, sus padres siempre  mantenía aves en su casa, luego decidió ir a un agroservicio a pedir  asesoría técnica sobre esta actividad; la cual le facilitaron. En seguida compro 200 pollas y con los conocimientos logro tenerlas hasta el final de la postura, luego las descarto y metió un nuevo lote, fue como le gusto la actividad y sigue trabajando en ello hasta la fecha. 

Antes de esta actividad solo se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos,  por la falta de recursos económicos. La granja donde están las aves esta a 1km de su casa; ya que por higiene no puede tenerlas más cerca de su casa y para llegar se moviliza a veces en el carro o en bicicleta o a pie, al cuido de las gallinas le ayuda su esposa. Generalmente trabaja de 7 am a 5 de la tarde.


   Don Dimas con el financiamiento, comprara 40 quintales de concentrado. El crédito mejorara su calidad de vida, ya que  comprar  todo el concentrado y no estar viajando seguido al agroservicio e incurrir en más gastos de transporte. El crédito mejorara  sus ingresos y cubrira así las necesidades básicas de su familia.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando con aves, ampliar sus galeras para meter más pollas,  que le generen más ingresos y con sus ganancias ayudar  a su hijo para que termine la carrera que a elegido.
texts.en:
Dimas, 66, studied up to sixth grade.  He's married and his wife works on the farm taking care of their laying hens.  His oldest child works in the capital and his next one, a daughter, works for the city.  The third one lives in the United States and the fourth one is currently a student in his second year of legal studies.

Dimas makes a living raising and selling laying hens.  He also has a small metal shop where he fabricates doors, windows, and the like.  He has sold chickens for 15 years.  His parents always had poultry at home.  Then he decided to go to an agroservice for technical advice about this job.  On their advice he immediately bought 200 hens and because of his knowledge managed to keep them until they stopped laying.  Then he got rid of them and bought another lot.  He liked the work and has continued with it up to the present.

Before this job Dimas worked growing basic grains because of a lack of economic resources.  The farm where he keeps his poultry is a kilometer from his house; he can't keep them closer because of hygiene issues.  He gets there by car or bicycle or on foot.  His wife helps him take care of the hens.  He generally works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m.

Dimas will buy 40 quintals of concentrated feed with the loan.  It will improve his quality of life because he'll buy the feed all at once and not have to travel frequently to the agroservice.  The loan will improve his income and cover his family's basic necessities.

His dream is to continue working with poultry and expand his coops with more hens to generate more income.  With his profits he wants to help his son finish his chosen educational program.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel his home

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who is still small.  She has been a food vendor for four years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Anna's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use for increasing on her food stock and meet her clients' demands. She dreams of owning a big hotel. 

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "MOMELA," which has a total of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on her food stock and meet her clients' demands

loans.name: Minavar

texts.en:
Minovar was born in the year 1956. She is widowed, with a son. Her son is married and has some children. So, she lives with her large family in a north part of Tajikistan. 

Minovar has been busy with growing crops. She has her own land. Minovar’s working day begins early morning. She works hard every day. She has additional income from animal husbandry. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 to buy seeds for the new season and also to buy cattle for increasing the number of her cattle. 

She is a repeat client of IMON. Minovar awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds for the new season and also to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Merkara

texts.en:
Merkara, aged 32, is a private entrepreneur from a rural village of Kandal province. She lives with her husband and three children. With the help of her oldest child, Merkara runs a general store from her home, where she sells different grocery products to local villagers. Merkara and her spouse put their efforts together to be able to provide basic necessities and educate their children.

Merkara has applied for a loan to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. With the loan support, she hopes that everyone in her family can live a comfortable lifestyle. This water loan program encourages healthy living conditions, which safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia tiene 52 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de caña, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte Perú.

Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, sus hijos le apoyan en esta labor.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mejor precio, generándole ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 52 years old and lives with her children in the District of Cayalti. Her town is known for agriculture, primarily the cultivation of sugar cane, as well as for trade and livestock breeding. This community is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

For the past five years, Eufemia has been raising and selling small animals. Her business is located behind her home. Her children help with the work. Eufemia is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed and small animals that she can fatten. She will sell them later at a better price so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: İbrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 28, is single and lives with his parents and sister. His mother has been sick for a long time and his sister cares for her. Ibrahim’s father is a bus driver.

Ibrahim rents a small store where he sells various vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, onions, and apples. He has been in this business for 3 years. Now İbrahim plans to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables and is requesting a loan of 1,650 AZN. Ibrahim is thankful for the help. 

He is confident that this loan will help increase his business and earn more money. In the future, he wants to repair his store. İbrahim would also like to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell in his store.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun, age 45, is a resident living in a remote area of Kandal province. To ensure that his family have enough food and to meet their needs, Aun is engaged in farming and animal sales. Having been in these two businesses for years, he is able to make a suitable income to raise and educate his children. His animal sale business started in the past 5 years. Aun and his wife have a good cooperation and strive to work hard to improve their living conditions. 

At this time, Aun would like to acquire a loan in the sum of USD 1,000 to buy a used motorcycle for his employed children who are currently working in Phnom Penh. This motorcycle will help them reduce the unnecessary costs incurred by them due to commuting to work. Aun is very grateful to all the kind lenders for their loan support, which enables him to develop his family’s living status.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for his children.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en concubinato y tiene un pequeño hijo que depende de él, alcanzo a salir bachiller pero no entro a la universidad por falta de recursos, vive en el domicilio de un pariente suyo en calidad de cuidador. Su actividad económica es prestar servicios de transporte urbano con su propio vehículo en una empresa de radio taxi con una experiencia de 5 años, actualmente solicita un crédito para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo, de esta forma prestará un servicio más eficiente y podrá generar más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl is 40 years old and in a common-law relationship. He has a young child who is dependent on him. Raúl reached the high school level, but he was not able to enter the university due to a lack of resources. He lives at a relative's house where he acts as the caretaker.

Raúl's job involves providing city transportation services with the use of his own vehicle. He works for a radio taxi company and has five years of experience. Raúl is currently requesting a loan so that he can can repair and maintain his vehicle. This will enable him to provide more efficient service and to generate more income to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Teodolinda

texts.es:
María Teodolinda tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, en una zona rural donde su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral en la parte posterior a su domicilio, adicionalmente tiene un puesto de venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, es muy reconocida en su zona por la amabilidad con sus clientes y vecinos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para comprar ropa de temporada primavera verano y de esta manera tener en stock para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
María Teodolinda is 30 years old and lives with her husband and child in a rural area in the District of Oyotun. Her town is known for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. This community is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

María Teodolinda raises and sells poultry in an area behind her home. In addition, she has a vending stall where she sells clothes for women, men, and children. She is well-known in her area for the friendly way she treats her customers and neighbors.

María Teodolinda is requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy seasonal clothing for spring and summer. This will enable her to have inventory that she can offer to her customers, thereby generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for spring and summer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks and increase her revenue

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 43 years old and married.  She has been doing business selling vegetables and fruits for many years. 

She is very enthusiastic in her business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is the loving mother of four children and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, and guavas. 

She is expecting boost in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, and guavas.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is 66 years old and retired from the Martvili district. She is married and lives alone at the moment as her husband lives and works abroad. The main source for income for Tsiala is her retirement pension. She seldom gets money from her husband as he does not have a stable job and income.
 
Tsiala is seeking an additional source of income and now is requesting a loan to start a clothing sales business. She will purchase apparel and household items and sell them from her house to community members. She will offer her customers quality things at reasonable prices. Tsiala wants to take orders for some clothing and items. She hopes her business initiative will give her a chance to earn savings and improve her standard of living in future.

loans.use: to buy clothing and linens for resale.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 44 years old and married, the mother of four children. 

She is been in the work of hand embroidery for a period of about six years. She is passionate about her work, and her clientele is good. 

She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. She also stitches clothes to generate an extra amount of income. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old married woman who has sold milk to her community for many years. Farzana also works with her husband and they have become famous for providing good quality milk. She makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Farzana has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 8th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one an additional cow. Farzana is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Amon, who is an active member of the Tupendane group, has been running an enterprise selling fish for five years now. He also runs a motorbike service commonly known as bodaboda. He runs his business activities from 7:30 am to the midnight hours and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Amon will use this loan to buy more fish to resell. This will be Amon's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loan, which has been repaid, Amon restocked his supply of fish to sell to more people. He is doing great and still working hard to meet his business ambitions. He used the extra money from business to cover school fees and household expenses. He also bought nineteen iron sheets for his house. Amon dreams to own another successful enterprise and own a business bus. 

He will share this loan with his loan group " Tupendane" which totals 3 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying backing the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to increase stock for resell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is 33-years-old. He is married, has 1-year-old child, and lives with his family in Armavir. Albert’s wife doesn't work as she needs to take care of their child. Albert is involved in a construction business. He has been providing construction services for over 10 years. He receives orders from individuals and companies and works hard to meet his clients’ needs. Mainly he has been involved in the renovation of interiors and is already highly qualified and an experienced specialist. Albert needs financial support to be able to purchase tools and equipment that he needs for his work. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Albert, as he needs to have new tools and equipment which will give him an opportunity to provide better services.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment to use in providing construction services.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 19-year-old married woman who has been employed in a clothing shop for two years.

She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into earning her living and increasing her family's income. Daniel is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to open her own clothing shop to improve her living and to support her husband in improving his family's financial situation.

Daniel has good experience in this domain, and she believes that she is capable of running her own business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to open her own clothing shop to improve her living and to support her husband in improving his family's financial situation.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old. She is a single mother of three children. She is supporting all of her children through her Zoona mobile money transfer business. 
She accessed her first Kiva loan and used it to boost her working capital. This increased her revenue, and she was able to expand her business by opening additional five mobile money transfer shops.

Grace is now able to pay for her rentals, and recently purchased a trading booth as well as employed six people to help her with the business. She is grateful for the financial support from Kiva lenders because it enabled her to scale her business and earn more income.

Grace is requesting her second Kiva loan so she can boost her working capital at all five of her outlets. The profits will help her scale up the five outlets by having more cash on hand to serve customers.
  
Grace is working hard to expand her money transfer business so she is able to provide well for her three children.

loans.use: to increase her working capital so she can serve more customers at her five money transfer shops.

loans.name: Arfa

texts.en:
Arfa is 20 years old, married and is running a small general store in her community to support her family members.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, Arfa requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy a larger supply of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. This helps her meet the demands of her customers time after time. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 47 years old and married.  She has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years.  

She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.  She makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. 

In order to make greater profits, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy another buffalo. It will help her to increase her sales, which ultimately help in generating more income for her. 

She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 24-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been selling spices that are used in cooking food. She purchases spices in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good-quality spices in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. 

She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en: Afshan is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Five years ago, she started her own business selling cloths to contribute to the family income. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Afshan is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Afshan expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to sell.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is a 50-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business with the support of her son. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 43 years old. She is married and has two children ages 22 and 19.  Many years ago, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but are raised for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 45-year-old married mother of four children who works as a tailor from her house since 1993.

She is a hard working woman who puts so much effort in financially supporting her husband and family to make sure that they are getting the necessary living needs.

In addition to working as a tailor, she provides some medical services to neighbors and other customers upon request, through pricking medical needles to medicate children and any sick person who can be treated at home, and when medical syringe needles are requested.

Salam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a necessary medical machine for her son to help him in his living and make his life easier.  

She hopes to expand her business through moving her tailoring services outside her house and expecting new customers.

loans.use: to buy a necessary medical machine for her son to help him in his living and make his life easier

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 32-year-old single lady who's the sole breadwinner to three additional members of her family.

Nisrine is a hard worker who likes her business a lot. She works from her house since at the meantime she isn't financially capable of opening her own separate working place.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary newly released editing machines that will help her run her business easily, faster and produce higher quality.

She hopes that in the near future, and after investing this loan in a well managed way, she'll be capable of opening her own editing company outside her house.

loans.use: to buy necessary newly released editing machines that will help her run her business easily, faster, and produce higher quality

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 60-year-old married woman, who is the main financial support for her family. Her husband does not work at all and she works hard to better their living standards. She has operated her small convenience store since 1994. Amina sells canned food, cleaning detergents, chocolates, sweets, soft drinks, chips, cereals, and grains.

Amina is requesting her eighth loan cycle to improve her business through increasing its merchandise with special winter requested items such as cereals, hot drinks, and special treats that would benefit her customers during this cold season.

Amina hopes to stay in good health so remains capable of running her own business and making their living.

loans.use: To buy special winter requested items such as cereals, hot drinks and special treats to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sam Eng

texts.en:
Sam Eng is 24 years old, married, and has a small child. Sam Eng currently lives with his wife and child in his own home, located in Ang Snuol district, Kandal province. Sam Eng aims to provide his family a better quality of life, so he strives to work overtime very often as a garment worker. His wife is employed in the same factory. 

The challenge for them is that they don’t have a motorcycle to commute to work, so they must pay for a taxi service every day. This may increase their daily expenses. For this reason, Sam Eng is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 700 to buy a motorcycle to satisfy their transportation needs. Sam Eng expresses his thanks to all lenders who have contributed their funds to help poor a fellow like him improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for their transportation needs.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 34 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of four and ten. She will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to increase her maize production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is from the village of Berta. She is 31 years old and divorced with two school-aged sons. The family has only seasonal income from agricultural activities. They have a small plot of land for potato growing. The harvests are sold locally. In addition, Irma works as a dairymaid at a local farm in return for a small monthly wage. 

It’s often difficult for Irma to cover the costs of feeding her children, and that is the reason why Irma decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Irma will produce cheese for selling as well as family consuming. This loan will be a great help to Irma’s family, as it will generate income. Irma appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow and begin dairy farming.

loans.name: Neghat

texts.en: Neghat is a 50-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Neghat was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner, as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Neghat felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. Therefore, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She will use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 54-year-old married woman, and she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she requests a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase two more calves. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. Manvel lives with his family in Gyumri town. He is a kind and outgoing man. His wife is a teacher. She works in a kindergarten. 

Manvel himself has been providing excavation services for over five years. He receives different orders from neighboring villages and provides services with his own excavator. 

Unfortunately it is very old and needs to be renovated. Because of his family's daily costs, Manvel wasn't able to save money, so he has applied for this loan. He asks for this loan to be able to renovate his excavator and continue providing his service. 

Manvel has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly help Manvel as he will be able to renovate the excavator and will continue earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovating his old excavator so he  can continue to provide excavation services

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue, con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Hace un años que ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa, accesorios para bebe, plásticos, ropa interior para caballeros etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende mediante pedidos también. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir el negocio de ropa, accesirios para bebe, ropa interior y plásticos, su propósito es complacer siempre a la clientela con variedad de productos. Tiene como meta seguir manteniendo activo su negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con las ganancias que le genera.
texts.en: Karla is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, has two children, and lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara.  She started selling clothing, baby accessories, plastic ware, men’s undergarments, etc. two years ago.  She sells out of her home and also takes orders.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras so she can stock her business and always be able to please her customers with a variety of products.  Her goal is to remain active in her business so she can help her children with her earnings.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of two children, all of whom go to school which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Saumu has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past two years, selling to passers by and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-charging set, and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.
