Doña Verónica spends most of her time at home taking care of her children. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also grows crops, but only for household consumption.

The money from her loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and food for the animals. Her dream is for her children to study so that they can become successful professionals. She would also like to finish her own studies.

The two smaller photos are of three members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase a new motor bike for transportation purposes.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.40,000 to buy spare parts for her motor bike. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motor bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a manicure/pedicure chair, a massage machine, and supplies wholesale (cuticle cutters, nail clippers, files, nail polish, nail decorations, and others).

loans.name: Rosimeleane

texts.en:
Rosimeleane is 23 years old and a partner-woman, with three children. 

She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu, etc., in her community, and she has been doing this for many years. 

Rosimeleane has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, and bush knives.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Rosimeleane will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, and bush knives

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 41 years old and married, with two children.

She runs a business sewing "elei' clothing (Samoan clothing from printed fabrics) in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Epenesa has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, threads, and fabric material. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, and thread

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as grocery, goods, etc. She has been doing this for many years. 

Lisa needs a loan to buy noodles, sugar, flour, chicken, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, flour, chicken, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa is 37 years old and a partner woman with 7 children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Nesa has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a rake, garden hose, and gloves. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Nesa will expand her business to the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, rake, garden hose, and gloves

loans.name: Maaniama

texts.en:
Maanaima is 68 years old and a widow with 8 children. She makes and sells elei materials to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Maanaima has requested a loan to buy an elei board, brushes, paint, fabric material, and a new sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an elei board, brushes, paint, fabric, new sewing machine.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Shalom está en el 1er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. Este comité es de la Ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, donde las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Una de las señoras, Lidia,  trabaja en la venta de ropas variadas, y es gracias a este trabajo que trata de ayudar a su familia y de darles todo lo que pueda y tenga a su alcance, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante. Espera un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que redobla esfuerzos en pos de su ideal. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas y mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
The Shalom group is in its first program cycle.  This women's group is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  The group members say that their principal objective is the growth of each member; these members are recognized in the community as very hardworking women.

One of these women is Lidia.  She works selling different clothing items.  Thanks to this work, she helps her family; she gives them everything she can.  She is a woman who dedicates herself to getting ahead.  She hopes for a better future for her children, and it is for this reason that she is doubling her efforts.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various clothing items.  She will be able to continue with her sales and will thereby improve her economic state.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Taulapu

texts.en:
Taulapu is 30 years old and married, with one child. 

She runs a small business selling "faapapa" (a Samoan bread) and popcorn in her community, and she has been doing this for two years. 

Taulapu has requested a loan to buy sugar, dripping oil, popcorn, salt, flour, plastic bags, and baking soda. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Taulapu will help with her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, dripping oil, popcorn, salt, flour, plastic bags, and baking soda

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school and one underage. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a business woman who is very hardworking. She is a widowed woman with three children. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Dorothy has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Edigina

texts.en: Edigina appreciates her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
This is Nadzua. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase sacks of charcoal in her business.
She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.50,000, to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with eight children, six in school and two adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bananas, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, ground nuts, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, ground nuts, and sweets for resale

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe appreciates for her previous kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase house hold consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for resale.She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase house hold consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married mother of six children, three in school and three adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaka has operated a food production selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts, potatoes, and bread for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of ground nuts, potatoes, and bread for resale

loans.name: Nyamata

texts.en:
Nyamata is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is a widowed woman with six children.

Nyamata prepares goat meat and soup using goat head and legs and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 45,000 she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with six children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Nzadze has operated a fuel selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan of Kshs 35,000 to purchase gallons of fuel for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of fuel for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Ramón Anilio

texts.es: Ramón es un hombre luchador y dedicado a su familia, durante toda su vida productiva trabajó en diferentes empresas y talleres de confección, pero siempre con la visión y la proyección de tener su propio taller; sueño que logró cumplir hace aproximadamente 2 años, cuando con una máquina plana abrió su taller y comenzó a prestar el servicio a terceros; poco a poco fue creciendo y hoy en día cuenta con 11 máquinas y con el apoyo de 5 empleadas directas que trabajan con él todos los días de 8:00 am a 7:00 pm, logrando reconocimiento en el sector y generando así los recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una máquina plana y una fileteadora, lo que le permitirá aumentar su nivel de producción, disminuyendo el tiempo de producción y optimizando aún más su taller, lo que le genera un mayor nivel de ingresos y la posibilidad de adquirir nuevos contratos más grandes, pues tiene toda la capacidad instalada para realizarlo. Esto le permitirá a Ramón, seguir avanzando con su actividad y le abre las puertas para en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de sacar su línea propia de ropa; por ello sigue invirtiendo tiempo y dinero en su negocio, pues al final todo este esfuerzo se verá recompensado con una mejor calidad de vida para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Ramón is a persistent man who's devoted to his family.  Throughout his working life he has worked in various companies and tailor shops, but always with the vision and plan to have his own workshop.  He realized this dream about two years ago when he opened his shop with a sewing machine and started to offer service to third parties.  Little by little he grew, and today he has eleven machines and the help of five direct employees who work with him every day from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  He has recognition in the market and generates the money he needs to pay for his family's basic necessities.

Ramón's requesting the current loan to buy a sewing machine and an overlock machine so he can increase his production, reduce his production time, and optimize his shop even more.  This will generate a higher level of income and the possibility of acquiring new and bigger contracts, because now he has the capacity.

This allows Ramón to continue making progress in his job and opens the door to the future possibility of being able to achieve his dream of putting out his own line of clothing.  This is why he continues investing time and money in his business, because in the end all this effort will result in a better quality of life for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an overlock machine

loans.name: Om-Ali Group

texts.en:
Om-Ali group consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They asked for a 160,000 YER loan from AMB to buy different types of businesses. Nadia, 37 years old and a married woman with seven children, she is the leader of the group. She is illiterate and a good mother. She loves her husband and children very much and wants to do her best to see them happy. She knows that her husband's income can't cover all their needs, so she thought of starting up a small business.

She has a mill ("tahoun") and has been involved in purchasing grains then selling them to her customers after milling. She started her business because it has fast sales in the market and is attractive to business partners. She is an incredibly hard-working woman and as a result has a lot of experience. She said she provides people a service to put food on the table. Recently, she says that the main challenge to her business is a seasonal problem: during the dry season this type of product is very expensive. So she took out a loan of from AMB in order to purchase grain for her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase grain for milling

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling banana, taamu etc in her community and has been doing this for many years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and fertilizer for her plantation and buy cement, timber, and nails for home improvement. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elisapeta will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, cement, timber, and nails

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel es un grupo que se acaba de formar, todas ellas tienen el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas y emprendedoras.
Una de ellas es Irma, quien se dedica a la venta variada de joyas, ella es una persona con muchas expectativas para poder crecer por medio de las capacitaciones que está recibiendo. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo pueda tener un negocio donde vender sus joyas. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, ya que por medio de eso podrá seguir con su negocio y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Miguel is a newly formed group.  All of them have the goal of helping each other through everyone's effort.  They are very selfless and enterprising women.

One of them is Irma, who makes a living selling a variety of jewelry.  She's a person with a lot of expectations of being able to grow through the training she's receiving.  She wants to have a place to sell her jewelry over time.

Irma's requesting this loan to be able to invest in a variety of jewelry to sell because this way she'll be able to continue with her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Meapusi

texts.en:
Meapusi is 38 years old and a partner woman with 4 children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Meapusi has requested a loan to buy weedkiller, fertilizer, bush knives, backpack sprayer, boots, tarpaulin and a crowbar. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meapusi will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy weedkiller, fertilizer, bush knives, a backpack sprayer, boots, tarpaulin and a crowbar

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu is 42 years old, and a partner woman with four children. She runs a small business selling bananas, ta’amu (a root vegetable), etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Fetu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tarpaulin, a crowbar, bush-knives and a backpack sprayer. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fetu will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tarpaulin, a crowbar, bushknives and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Lolua

texts.en:
Lolua is 33 years old and a married woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling barbeque to the general public. 

Lolua has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, garlic, onion, soy sauce, tomato sauce, foam plates, and foil. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lolua will help with her family everyday need.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, garlic, onion, soy sauce, tomato sauce, foam plates and foil

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells elei (painted fabric) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Malama requested a loan to buy materials, paints, stencils, brushes, and elei design carved board. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints ,stencils,brushes and elei design carved board

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is 38 years-old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling banana, taamu, etc in her community and has been doing this for many years. Koreti has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, a rake,a pickax, a digging stick and a wheelbarrow. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2009 in order to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Koreti will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, a rake, a pickax, a digging stick and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 39-year-old single mother of two children. She runs a small canteen selling all sorts of cooked food in her community and has been doing this for many years. Hana has requested a loan to buy noodles, chicken, soy sauce, dripping oil, frying pan, curry powder, onions, sausages and rice. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2012 in order to gain access to capital. With her earnings,  Hana will help with her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy noodles, chicken, soy sauce, dripping oil, frying pan, curry powder, onions, sausages and rice.

loans.name: Taopaua

texts.en: Taopaua is 72-years-old and a widow with eight children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for four years. Taopaua has requested a loan to buy chicken legs, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, mutton flaps, salt and onions. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taopaua will extend her house.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, mutton flaps, salt and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items wholesale (chocolates, cookies, home products, sweets, and Christmas goods).

loans.name: Om-Hasan Group

texts.en: This group of four hard-working women is called Om-Hasan. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 160,000 YER from AMB. Nour is a 51-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan  from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials in order to finish building her house. She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials  in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Al-Kholany Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Kholany and it is made up of 5 women. All members are hardworking women who are making efforts to improve their living standards. Amira is a clever, skillful, and calm 31-year-old woman. She is a house wife and tries her best to provide a good life for her children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is an amazing person with unusually good, humane qualities. She wants a good future for her children because she missed the chance to study and receive a higher education. She would like to improve her home by buying new furniture and some home appliances, but the main hardship that she faces is a lack of money. For this reason, she took a loan from AMB. This loan will help her to improve her home and her living conditions.

loans.use: buying new furniture and some home appliances for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her store at wholesale (snacks, dairy products, meat, cookies, cleaning products, coffee, chocolate, candy, etc.)

loans.name: Tawfiq

texts.en: Tawfiq, 25, is a young man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen, with his family.  He started his business because he needed an income. He has been operating an Internet café that offer good services for clients. He started his business with self-financing and bought four computers. He is comfortable with this business because he realizes that he offers knowledge services for his clients rather than simply commercial services. He is applying for a loan from AMB that he will use to stock his business. He wants to expand the range of offerings to include things such as computer sales so that he can increase his income. He hopes to open phone accessories so that increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy computers to expand his business.

loans.name: Siala

texts.en: Siala is 27-years-old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling bananas, taamu and yams in her community and has been doing this for four years. Siala has requested a loan to buy tarpaulin, chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a crowbar. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2012 in order to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Siala will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tarpaulin, chemicals ,fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a crowbar.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es: Sonia, a sus 31 años de edad, ha sido víctima de la explotación laboral desde que tenía 7 años de edad, pues nació en una familia muy humilde en la que todos debían trabajar para conseguir el alimento, por lo que a ella le tocó vender dulces en las diferentes rutas de buses de la ciudad, de esta manera creció en el ambiente comercial y gracias a ello, hoy en día posee un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado en una calle del centro de la ciudad, en el que vende prendas tejidas en lana y otros artículos, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años y por la cual ya es reconocida en el sector; cuenta con la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo y puede programar la entrada de recursos pero, su principal desafío es tener que enfrentarse a los peligros que hay en la calle y a los cambios climáticos drásticos, además no cuenta con prestaciones sociales; sin embargo, sigue trabajando arduamente y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Su empuje, perseverancia y tenacidad, la impulsan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (sacos, pasamontañas, bufandas, guantes, entre otros productos tejidos en lana), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para ofrecer y así satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en las temporadas de invierno, logrando mejorar el nivel de ingresos. De esta forma, Sonia manifiesta que seguirá luchando para poder cumplir el sueño de montar su negocio en un local, en el que pueda estar más cómoda y sin estar expuesta a tantos riesgos que existen en la calle, además podrá mejorar las ventas y generar una estabilidad económica que le garantice una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Sonia is 31 years old and was a victim of child labor from the age of 7. This is because her family was poor and everyone had to work so that they could eat. Her job was to sell candy on different bus routes around the city. She grew up in a commercial enviroment and thanks to this she has managed to set up a small stall that she holds on one of the streets downtown where she sells knitted woollen clothing and other items. She has been running the stall for 10 years and is well-known in the area. She has the advantage of being able to decide her own hours and can manage her resources. Her main challenges are the dangers she faces on the streets and the dramatic changes of temperature. Moreover, she does not receive any social security. Nevertheless, she carrys on working hard and, in this way, generates enough income to be able to provide for her family's basic needs. Her drive, determination and tenacity have led to to look for other ways to carry on improving and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy products at wholesale (jackets, balaclavas, scarves, gloves, and other knitted clothing). This will allow her to have a wider variety of items to sell and meet customer demand which increases during the winter months, and therefore increase her income. Sonia will continue to work hard to achieve her goal of selling her goods in a store where she will be more comfortable and will not be exposed to as many risks as she is on the street. She will also be able to improve her sales and give herself financial stability which will guarantee a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy items at wholesale (jackets, balaclavas, scarves, gloves, and other wool products).

loans.name: Matile

texts.en:
Matile is 49 years old and a partnered woman with four children. She runs a small business selling meat pies in her community and has been doing this for five years. 


Matile has requested a loan to buy chicken, flour, soy sauce, onions and cooking oil. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Matile will help with her family’s everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken, flour, soy sauce, onions and cooking oil

loans.name: Fofoaivaoesea

texts.en:
Fofoaivaoesea is 49 years old and a married woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling banana, taamu, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Fofoaivaoesea has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a chainsaw. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fofoaivaoesea will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and a chainsaw

loans.name: Moeava

texts.en:
Moeava is 58 years old and a single mother with two children. She runs a small business selling bananas, ta’amu (a root vegetable) etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Moeava has requested a loan to buy a crowbar, a digging stick, bush knives, chemicals and fertilizer. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Moeava will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a crowbar, a digging stick, bushknives, chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en:
Salafai is a 51-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She has a small business of sewing. She has spent many years in this business. 

Salafai needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, and material. She will use her profits to improve her business. Salafai joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, and material.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en: Itagia  is 43-years-old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for two years. Itagia has requested a loan to buy chicken legs, sausages, garlic, soy sauce, mutton flaps, onions and salt. She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2012 in order to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Itagia will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, sausages, garlic, soy sauce, mutton flaps, onions and salt.

loans.name: Sokchin

texts.en:
Sokchin is 33 years old, living with his wife and two children in a rural village of the Stoeng Sen district. He and his wife make a living through working as waiters in a restaurant. Together, they can earn about US $4 per day to support their family. 

Sokchin is a client in his first cycle with VisionFund. Now he is applying for a loan to pay for his university’s tuition in order to study finance and banking. He hopes this loan will enable him to study until graduation so as to have a good and bright future.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Chong Kal district of Cambodia, Ret is 52 years old and married. She has seven children. To make a living, Ret does rice farming, grows cassava, and supplements her income by selling dessert. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about US $12 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Ret is a client in her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is applying for an educational loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fee, faculty of finance and banking. She hopes this loan will enable her to send and keep her son in the university. She also hopes that her children will have a good and bright future from his academics and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fee.

location.town: Odor Meanchey Province, Chong Kal District

loans.name: Ioka

texts.en: Ioka is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, salt, chicken, cigarettes, etc. She has been doing this for many years. Ioka needs a loan to buy snacks, tin fish, sugar, flour,dripping oil, soy sauce, cigarettes, soft drinks, toilet rolls, and tomato sauce. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, tin fish, sugar, flour, dripping oil, soy sauce, cigarettes, soft drinks, toilet rolls, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Teuteronome

texts.en: Teuteronome is 24 years old and married with 2 children. She makes and sells design materials to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. Teuteronome has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, fabric material, and a design board. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads, fabric material, and a design board.

loans.name: Maria Deicy

texts.es: La señora María tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años al cual mantiene sola, termino el colegio y no pudo continuar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Tiene como principal ingreso la cría y venta de chanchos, estos son comercializados a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, también cuenta con un segundo ingreso que proviene del servicio de limpieza en edificios de la ciudad. Tiene una casa que se encuentra en obra gruesa por ello solicita un crédito para la refacción de su vivienda, de esta forma podrá proporcionarle a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María, 38, is single and has a son, 6, whom she supports on her own.  She finished high school and wasn't able to continue her studies because she lacked the resources.

María's main income is raising and selling pigs to various restaurants in the area.  She also has a second income from cleaning buildings in the city.

María's house is under construction so she's requesting a loan to make improvements.  This way she'll be able to give her son better living conditions.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. His son is studying in the first course of college and a daughter goes to the 11th grade in school. His wife is a housewife and helps Mahammad in his business. Mahammad’s family have been IDP (Internally Displacted Persons) from Füzuli city for 20 years and now they live in Shixli village of Füzuli region.

Mahammad has cows. He buys calves, raises them, and sells them in local bazaar to earn money. Now Mahammad wants to buy more cows to increase business. Therefore he needs a loan amount of 1350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Mahammad is thankful to the Kiva company, Komak organization and lenders for this loan. In the future, in order to increase his business, Mahammad wants to build a big stall.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Uani

texts.en:
Uani is a widowed woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: Masika appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of KSH 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who works so hard to meet her daily needs. Her previous loan was a big help to her business and she appreciates for the funds.She is requesting for a loan of KSH 40,000 to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a widowed woman with seven children, five in school and two adults. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

Kwekwe has operated a coconut-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Margarita María

texts.es: Margarita, a sus 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Desde que era muy joven descubrió su gusto por el arte, la pintura y las manualidades, razón por la cual realizó un curso de capacitación particular y comenzó a elaborar diferentes artículos decorativos para el hogar, como figuras en yeso, tendidos de cama, entre otros y comenzó a vender los artículos que elabora a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, de esta manera genera recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La cliente es una persona muy creativa, organizada y dedicada a su familia y a su labor, esto la impulsa a buscar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar materiales e implementos de trabajo (pinceles, telas, hilos, pinturas, figuras en yeso y cerámica, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener los materiales disponibles para elaborar sus artesanías y así satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de navidad, lo que para ella significa la posibilidad de percibir mejores recursos para seguir aportando a la economía del hogar e invertir en su negocio. Margarita sueña con darle continuidad a su labor y en un futuro cercano desea tener su taller en un local comercial, que le permita adecuar allí mismo el punto de venta de sus artículos, para mejorar las ventas y darse a conocer en un espacio mucho más amplio y concurrido, de esta manera estará en la capacidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia y disfrutar un mejor bienestar.
texts.en: Margarita is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. From a young age, she discovered that she had a passion for art, painting and crafts. For this reason, she took a course and started selling different decorative items for the home, such as figurines made of plaster and bedspreads to family members, neighbors and friends. Through this, she has managed to generate income to support her husband with the household expenses. She is a very creative and organized person who is dedicated to her family and her work. This has led her to request the support of a loan to buy supplies and tools (paintbrushes, fabric, thread, paints, plaster and ceramic figurines,etc). If she has these supplies, she will be able to create her handicrafts and satisfy the demand that increases during the holiday season, which means that she will increase her income and be able to carry on contributing towards the household expenses and be able to invest in her business. Margarita dreams of taking her business a step further by transferring her workshop to commercial premises where she would also be able to sell her products. This would improve sales and allow her to reach more customers, and  as a consequence would mean that she could improve the quality of hers and her family's life so that they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools (paintbrushes, fabric, thread, paints, plaster  and ceramic figurines)

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna lives in Norapat village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. Ruzanna's elder son serves in the army and the other one Babken (in the photo) is currently a student at Armenian State University of Physical Culture. Ruzanna and her husband work hard to be able to cover the family's daily costs. Because of hard times that family is currently facing, they aren't able to pay for Babken's education costs. They are asking this loan for being able to cover Babken's university tuition and give him an opportunity to complete the education. Babken himself dreams of becoming a boxer and does his best to make his goals true and give an appropriate life to his parents.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is 29 years old. She is married with two children (ages 10 and 6). Shushanik currently studies at Goris State University in the department of pedagogy. Shushanik works hard to be able to manage her studies and household work. She studies hard to get her higher education degree and become a teacher. Shushanik's husband perfectly manages to cover family's daily costs, but unfortunately there is no money left for paying for Shushanik's education.

That's the reason Shushanik is currently requesting this loan. She has applied for it to be able to pay for university tuition and complete her education. She will be very grateful to lenders for giving her an opportunity to make her dream come true and become a teacher.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is 44 years old and married. She lives with her husband in a rural area located in the Srey Snom District, Cambodia. She has been farming rice, growing cassava, and raising pigs for 26 years. The current business earns her about KHR 26,000 per day, but she can save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sarom has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has repaid her previous loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fee.

loans.name: Sokny

texts.en:
Sokny, 49, is from a rural village located in the Srey Sonthor District of Kampong Cham Province. She is a married mother of five children. To earn a living, she has been growing various kinds of vegetables and farming rice. She is able to earn about US $11 to support her family.

Sokny is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for an educational loan to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter's university, to study accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to get a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her daughter's university.

loans.name: Ann Maa Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support Otara. She is the president of Ann Maa Manikeswari Group and is pictured here in the bright yellow sari in the front row. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India.

With her portion of the loan, Otara will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their three children together. After this loan, Otara will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. Otara is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm.

The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn from expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine which they can all use to make spices and pickle vegetables together.

loans.use: to buy more cows and expand her dairy farm

loans.name: Tae

texts.en: Tae is a 44-year-old married woman with 7 children. She has a small bingo business for 2 years. Tae needs a loan to buy a new bingo machine and bingo paper. She will use her profits to improve her business. Tae joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine and bingo paper.

loans.name: Salevasa

texts.en: Salevasa is 33 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling bananas and taamu in her community for the past many years. Salevasa has requested a loan to buy weedkiller, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and a digging stick. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Salevasa will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, and a digging stick.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 35 woman who has been living with her partner for 13 yrs with 8 children. She has a small business: bingo. She has been in this business one year. Eseta needs a loan to buy new bingo machine, bingo paper, and a desk and chair. She will use her profits to improve her business. Eseta joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine, bingo paper, a desk, and a chair.

loans.name: Faatuli

texts.en: Faatuli is 49 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. Faatuli has requested a loan to buy raw bananas, oil, salt, spicy seasoning and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faatuli will help with her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy raw bananas, oil, salt, spicy seasoning and plastic bags.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 36-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Kalala has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovels, gloves, a wheelbarrow, rakes and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Kalala hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, gloves, a wheelbarrow, rakes and bush knives.

loans.name: Leataosina

texts.en:
Leataosina is 47 years old and married, with two children. 

She runs a small canteen selling all sorts of food items in her community, and she has been doing this for many years.

Leataosina has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, curry powder, and salt, but part of her loan will buy cement, timber, and iron roofing for home renovation. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Leataosina will help with her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy cement, timber, iron roofing, chicken, sausages, curry powder, and salt

loans.name: Maricia

texts.es:
Maricia es un mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ya que es madre de 3 hijos y por ellos lucha cada día por mejorar sus condiciones de vida; Maricia para poder tener ingresos para su hogar logro ahorrar e iniciar su negocio de venta de cervezas desde hace 5 años y también alquila un pequeño cuarto con el cual tiene un dinero extra para las emergencias de su hogar.

Maria agradece la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar materiales de construcción par pode realizar mejoras en su vivienda especialmente comprara madera, calaminas, clavos, entre otros; así podrá seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Maricia's a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She's the mother of three children and strives every day to improve their living conditions.  Five years ago Maricia managed to save and start her business selling beer to have income for her household.  She also rents a small room so she has extra money for household emergencies.

María's grateful for the help of the Kiva lenders because thanks to them she'll be able to buy construction supplies to make improvements on her home.  In particular, she'll buy wood, corrugated metal, nails, and other supplies.

This way she'll continue making the effort to achieve her dream of having a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: Don José es un humilde señor de 55 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada. Casado y padre de cuatro hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio técnico en refrigeración, se dedica al taller de refrigeración. Inicio este negocio hace quince años. Anteriormente era trabajador y luego se independizo pare tener su propio taller con dinero propio. Tiempo después, busca el apoyo de su yerno para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Actualmente cuenta con otro ayudante y con un negocio prospero de alta demanda de clientes. Su meta es seguir cumpliendo eficientemente con el servicio a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: desarmadores, repuestos de refrigeración, rash entre otros, con el fin de dar un servicio de calidad. Estima que le crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio y suplir con las necesidades de sus clientes.  Su plan futuro es mantener el negocio por más tiempo.
texts.en:
José, 55, is a modest man from the city of Grananda.  He's married and the father of four adult children.

José's a refrigerator technician by trade and makes a living with a refrigeration shop, a business he started 15 years ago.  Before that he worked as a laborer but went out on his own with a shop so he could have his own income.  Later he sought his father-in-law's help to fill his customer demand.  Currently he has another helper and a prosperous business with high demand from his customers.  His goal is to continue giving his customers efficient service.

José's requesting the loan to buy screwdrivers, refrigerator parts, and other things to provide quality service.  He thinks the loan will help him grow his business and supply his customers' needs.  His plan for the future is to keep running his business longer.

loans.use: to buy screwdrivers, refrigerator parts, and other things

loans.name: Marta Veneranda

texts.es:
Doña Marta tiene 62 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside en compañía de su esposo y una hija en el Municipio de Nueva Frontera, Departamento de Santa Bárbara.
Doña Marta inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 7 años con el fin de obtener ingresos para contribuir a la economía del hogar. Ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como: granos básicos, productos de aseo, lácteos, azúcar, manteca, verduras, golosinas y refrescos.
Ella ha solicitado otro crédito por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que invertirá adquiriendo productos para surtir su pulpería como granos básicos, productos de limpieza, lácteos, refrescos, azúcar y otros que demandan sus clientes.
Con esta inversión va poder aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer mejor a sus clientes.
Sus metas son crecer en su negocio manteniéndolo bien surtido y obtener mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Marta is 62 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives with her husband in the town of Nueva Frontera, within the Santa Barbara department.

Marta opened her store seven years ago so she could obtain an income to help with the household finances.  She sells basic food products such as basic grains, toiletries, dairy, sugar, lard, vegetables, snacks, and soft drinks. 

She is asking for another loan of 5,000 Lempiras so she can buy products for her store, such as basic grains, cleaning products, dairy, soft drinks, sugar, and other things that her customers want.

This investment will allow her to increase her sales and better serve her customers.

Her goals are to grow her business, keep it well stocked and be more helpful.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his store at wholesale (snacks, cleaning products, cookies, soda, dairy products, meat, pasta, grains, etc).

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es: Lilia tiene 41 años es casada, de sus 03 hijos solo el mayor trabaja los demás están en la escuela. Lilia es integrante de la alcancía “LIDER DE DEFENSORES” ser parte del grupo es lo que la animo a empezar su propio negocio, se siente feliz vendiendo ropa porque poco a poco su negocio ha surgido; en la actualidad sus ventas son mayores permitiendole tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para la nueva estación. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener un local para poner su tienda de ropa por el momento lo hace con entregas por pedido. El grupo está agradecido a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo. En la foto lilia es la quinta de la izquierda (paradas), viste chompa negra y pantalon jean.
texts.en:
Lilia is 41 years old and married. She has three children, but only the oldest one is working while the others are in school.

Lilia is a member of the Communal Bank "Lider de Defensores". In order to be part of this group, she was encouraged to start her own business. She is pleased to be selling clothes because her business has gradually increased. At the moment, her sales have improved, so she has more income to help her family.

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing for the new season. Her greatest wish in life is to have a location where she can open a clothing store. She currently delivers the completed orders.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan. In the photo, Lilia is standing on the far left wearing a black sweater and jeans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arcenia

texts.es: Arcenia, hace dos años se dedica a críar y comercializar cerdos, actividad que aprendió con su familia desde que era muy joven. Su negocio inició cuando compró unos marranos con algunos ahorros que tenía, los engordó y luego los sacrificó para venderlos por kilos, viendo que esto le generaba buenas ganancias, cada vez compraba más cerdos para engorde y empezó a trabajar diariamente en esta actividad, de esta manera ha logrado generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su familia, que está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos. Su empuje, esmero y dedicación la impulsan a buscar alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar más cerdos y el concentrado para el engorde de los animales; lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda de este tipo de carne que se incrementa con la llegada de la temporada decembrina; mejorando así la entrada de recursos económicos para su familia. Esto le abrirá la posibilidad de seguir creciendo con su labor, adicionalmente podrá llegar a cumplir el sueño de adecuar un espacio más amplio en el que pueda tener mayor número de animales, lo que para Arcenia significa fortalecer y acreditar su actividad, y con la que podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de las personas que ama.
texts.en: Arcenia has been raising and selling pigs for the past two years, a trade that she learned from her relatives from an early age. She started her business by buying a few pigs and used some savings that she had to fatten them and sacrifice them so that they could be sold by the kilo. As she made a good profit, she decided to buy more pigs to fatten and started working daily in this area. In this way, she has been able to generate income to take home to her family, which is made up of her husband and their two children. Her drive, commitment and dedication have led her to look for ways to get ahead, and that is why she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy more pigs and concentrate for fattening. This will help to increase production and satisfy the demand for this type of meat, which goes up during the month of December, This will mean that she increases her family's income and will have the opportunity to grow her business and perhaps even fulfil her dream of finding bigger premises so that she can have more animals, All of this would mean that Arcenia could strengthen and improve her business in order to improve the quality of life and well-being of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and concentrate for fattening.

loans.name: Maa Budhithakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
Sukanti, pictured here in the blue sari second from left in the first row, is the president of Maa Budhithakurani Self Help Group (SHG). She is 26 with two children and formed this group to help the women in her village improve their livelihoods so they can better support their families. Together, the women in the group live in a small village in the coastal region of Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Most of the women either raise fish, work in dairy farming, or operate small individual businesses in the village.

Sukanti will use a portion of her group's 150,000 rupee loan to expand her fishery. Specifically, she will buy fish food and baby fish to raise in a pond near her house. She is confident that increasing the number of fishes she raises will increase her family income and allow her to have enough money to send her kids to extra tutoring courses in the evenings so that they will be able to perform better in their studies and get a good education. It will help a lot for her family to be more independent, she says, and also earn a better standard of living. Her husband works as a mechanic and she will use some of the profits from her fishery to invest in his business as well.

The women in Maa Budhithakurani SHG dream of purchasing a large pond so they can raise more fish together and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy fish food and baby fish to raise in her fish pond

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es una señora esforzada y trabajadora, con una gran necesidad de reparar su vivienda, ya que está muy deteriorada y en época de lluvia se filtra el agua, ella solicita un préstamo por quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, cemento, arena , etc, Hilda manifoiesta la gran alegría que tiene al contar con este financiamiento tan ágil y accesible.
texts.en: Hilda is a hardworking woman who puts forth a lot of effort.  She has a great need to repair her home, which is very deteriorated and water leaks in during the rainy season.  She is asking for a loan of 500,000 Colones (¢500.000) to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting, cement, sand, etc.  Hilda shows the great happiness she has in being able to access this agile and accessible financing.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La señora Gladys vive en la población de Entre Ríos, en el barrio Jordán y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Vende comida rápida, su actividad económica se encuentra  a lado de la terminal donde tiene mucha clientela, gracias a todo su esfuerzo y trabajo diario, adquirió un lote urbano, pero no tiene dinero para empezar la construcción por lo mismo solicita un crédito para construir una vivienda propia ya que  actualmente vive en alquiler, de esta forma podrá ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys lives in the neighborhood of Jordán in the town of Entre Ríos. She has two dependent children.

Gladys sells fast food. Her business is set up next to a terminal where there are many customers. Thanks to her daily effort and work, she was able to acquire a plot of land in town. However, she does not have the money to start construction. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can build a house of her own since she currently lives in a rental property. This will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Agapito

texts.es: El señor Agapito es una persona responsable y trabajadora, es soltero y se dedica al servicio de mecánica de motocicletas, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene establecido su taller en la casa de sus tíos y es ahí donde vive desde que era niño, también se dedica a la venta de repuestos y solicita un crédito para  comprar repuestos para motocicleta ya que quiere aumentar su mercadería y generar más ingresos económicos, para cubrir sus gastos y ayudar a sus tíos en el pago de los servicios básicos de la casa.
texts.en: Agapito is a responsible and hard-working single man. He repairs motorcycles for a living and works from Monday to Sunday. He has his own garage at his uncles' house where he has lived since he was a child. He also sells spare parts, and he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles, He wants to increase his sales and create more income to cover his expenses and help his uncles out with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer campesina de 41 años de edad que, se dedica a realizar todas las tareas del campo, pues posee cerdos para engorde y comercialización, vende huevos y adicionalmente es propietaria de un cultivo de maíz; trabaja en estas actividades desde hace 20 años, día a día sin descanso, con el ánimo de generar recursos que le permitan aportar a la economía de su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar 2 lechones para cría y engorde y abonos agrícolas al por mayor (fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, entre otros), con lo que podrá aumentar la producción y mejorar los ingresos que percibe, ya que con la llegada de la temporada de navidad se incrementa el consumo de carne de cerdo, lo que para ella significa aumentar su nivel de ventas, además tendrá la posibilidad de sacar una cosecha de maíz mucho más productiva gracias a los cuidados que le dará con los insumos agrícolas. Claudia manifiesta su interés para darle continuidad a su labor, pues su sueño es poder ampliar y fortalecer aún más su negocio para que éste le genere mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Claudia is a 41-year-old rural woman who carries out various types of agricultural work. She fattens pigs to sell; she sells eggs; and she also owns land where she grows corn. She has been carrying out these different jobs every day without rest for the last 20 years in order to get enough money to take home to her family. She is currently requesting a loan to buy two piglets to raise and fatten and to buy agricultural supplies in bulk (fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.) so that she can increase production and increase her income, especially because people buy more pork than usual during the Christmas season meaning that she has the opportunity to increase her sales significantly. The loan will also make it possible for her to reap a better harvest of corn because she will be able to take care of the land better with the agricultural supplies. Claudia wants to carry on working, and her dream is to grow and strengthen her business so that it is more profitable and so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets to raise and fatten as well as agricultural supplies in bulk (fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.)

loans.name: Jageswari Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group's loan will go to Suchitra, a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a small village in the state of Odisha, on the eastern coast of India.

Suchitra is pictured on the extreme right in the image above. She owns a stationary shop in the village and would like to expand her shop by buying more items such as paper, envelopes, pens, and pencils. With her portion of her group's 135,000 Rupee loan, she can buy these items in bulk at a cheaper price and earn a higher profit. Her husband works alongside her and all of their family income is dependent on the shop. 

This is Suchitra's first loan, so she is excited and hopes that with the increased stock, they will be able to save more money. Most importantly, she wants to be able to support her children's education as they grow. As a child, she was only able to study until the second standard, but now she is working hard to send her children to a good school and hopes they will become engineers.
  
The other women in Jagaswari SHG are planning to use their loans for their own small shops or agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to purchase paper, envelopes, pens and pencils for her stationary shop

loans.name: Honorio Wilder

texts.es:
Honorio es un hombre muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de mecánica, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Honorio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar una maquila desenllantadora, con lo cual podrá realizar mejor su trabajo y poder atender a sus clientes de mejor manera, así podrá seguir esforzándose en su negocio y cumplir su sueño:” Tener una gran taller mecánico”.
texts.en:
Honorio is a very hard-working man. With a lot of effort, he was able to start his own mechanic business, with which he is able to earn money to get ahead.

Honorio is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their support he will be able to buy a tire removal machine. With this, he will be able to do his work better and will be able to attend to his customers in the best possible manner. He will thus be able to keep striving in his business and to fulfill his dream: "To have a great mechanic shop."

loans.use: to buy a tire removal machine

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Don José tiene 38 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos. Es originario de la ciudad de Granada. De oficio comerciante y contador, se dedica al negocio de cafetín. Inicio este negocio hace dos años. Trabajaba como contador y oficial de crédito en un micro financiera. Después obtuvo un negocio en uno de los mercados de la ciudad pero lo vendió porque no le generaba muchas ganancias, y con el dinero  obtenido de esa venta construyo su vivienda y parte de su negocio. Actualmente cuenta con el negocio de cafetín ubicado en unos de los colegios de la ciudad. Su meta es que crezca su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: golosinas, gaseosa, útiles escolares, entre otros, con el fin de suplir con la demanda de los estudiantes. Estima que este crédito será beneficioso ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias para remodelar su negocio. Su plan futuro es mantener la variedad de productos y así crecer más su cafetín.
texts.en: José is 38 years old. He is single and doesn’t have children. He is from the city of Granada. His occupation is in commerce and as an accountant. His business is a small cafe. He began the business two years ago. He used to work as as an accountant and a loan officer at a micro finance organization. After that he obtained a business at one of the markets in the city, but he sold it because it didn’t generate much income. With the money he earned from that, he built his house and part of his business. He now has his small cafe business located in one of the city’s high schools. His goal is to grow his business. He is requesting the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, school supplies, and other things, with the goal of fulfilling the demand from the students. He believes the loan will be beneficial because he will be able to improve his income and remodel his business. His plan for the future is to maintain the variety of products and grow his small cafe.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, and school supplies, among other items.

loans.name: Arabinda Shg Group

texts.en:
Kamala is pictured above in the green sari, second from the left in the front row. She has united the women in her village to form Arabinda SHG so they can work alongside each other to grow their businesses and contribute to the welfare of their family and their village. 

For work, she owns a tent house, a staple shop in her community that provides colorful coverings for weddings, engagements, and other festivities. A talented seamstress, Kamala makes and mends all of the tents herself from cloth. With her portion of the group loan, she will buy some new colors and replace some of her cloths that have worn out. In addition, she also likes to rent out other necessities for festivals and would like to use her loan to buy an updated sound system for her customers so that she can rent it out at a higher price.

She hopes to use the earnings from her tent house to continue to send her children to good schools, which get more expensive as they grow older. The other women in her group are mostly in dairy farming and own other small shops in the village.

loans.use: to buy an updated sound system to rent and more cloths to make tents to rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted items wholesale (pastries, beer, soft drinks, liquor and grocery products)

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: El señora Dionicia vive en la provincia de Tiraque en casa de sus padres, es madre soltera tiene un hijo que depende de ella, pero no tiene muchos recursos económicos, para trabajar tiene que contratar personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos y después ir a vender en la feria local, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado y semilla, de esta forma podrá seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Dionicia lives at her parents' house in Tiraque Province. She is a single mother with a child who is dependent on her.

Even though she does not have a great deal of financial resources, Dionicia must hire seasonal laborers to help her with planting and harvesting her products. Afterwards, she sells her crops at the local fair. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy livestock and seeds. This will enable her to continue working so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana Virginia, tiene 31 años de edad, es Lic. en derecho y ejerce su profesión por cuenta propia, alquila un local y ha puesto un foto estudio en donde toma fotos, hace legalizaciones de documentos, levantado de texto, encolochado, con el apoyo de su madre. Ana es soltera y no tiene hijos aun, busca la manera de mejorar su vivienda, solicita este crédito para poder comprar los materiales para construir un anexo que hará en dos etapas, siendo esta la primera,  para dicho objetivo necesita comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar la mano de obra, esta mejora le permitirá mayor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Virginia, 31, has a law degree and practices her profession independently.  She rents a space and has set up a photo studio where she takes photographs, legalizes documents, scans texts, and binds books with her mother's help.

Ana's single and has no children yet.  She's trying to find ways to improve her home.  She's requesting this loan to buy the supplies to build an addition that she'll do in two stages.

This is the first stage, for which Ana needs to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, and rebar, and pay for labor.  This improvement will make her home more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta, tiene 74 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 6 años que Doña Marta tiene su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, ella comenzó vendiendo solo refrescos y ahora vende azúcar, arroz, manteca, productos de aseo, pan, verduras, churros, y otros abarrotes. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo siendo el noveno ciclo y es por 8,000 Lempiras, con el cual va seguir surtiendo la pulpería con productos básicos como pan, refrescos, churros, jabón, manteca, azúcar, arroz, café, condimentos etc. Su propósito es seguir trabajando para ayudar en lo que pueda a su familia.
texts.en: Marta is 74 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Marta has had her business selling food products for the past 6 years. She began by selling just soft drinks, and now she sells sugar, rice, shortening, cleaning products, bread, chips, and other grocery items. She is currently requesting another loan, since this is the ninth loan cycle, for HNL 8,000.00 (Honduras Lempiras). She will use it to continue stocking her small grocery store with basic products such as bread, soft drinks, chips, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, condiments, etc. Her goal is to continue working so she can help her family as much as she can.

loans.use: bread, soft drinks, chips, soap, shortening, rice, coffee, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Sundos

texts.en: Sundos is 18 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her three siblings and her parents. Her father is retired from the military. Sundos is studying in her first year for a Bachelor of History degree. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially. Her parents are currently facing a financial crisis, which prevents them from paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, con quien tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Con el propósito de ayudar a su familia ha decidido tener su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos como lociones, cremas, maquillajes etc. y ropa nueva como blusas, pantalones, ropa interior por encargos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de cosméticos como lociones, cremas y ropa como jeans, blusas y ropa interior, para tener mayor inventario y aumentar las ventas. su meta es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 33 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has two children. She lives in the municipality of Masica, Atlántida. With the goal of helping her family, she has decided to have her own business selling cosmetics such as perfumes, lotions, make up, etc. and new clothing, such as blouses, pants, and underwear by special order. She makes her sales by working as a street seller and in her house. The loan she requests is for HNL 8,000.00 (Honduras Lempiras) and she will invest it in buying cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions and clothing such as jeans, blouses, and underwear so she can have a larger inventory and increase her sales. Her goal is to continue working in order to help her children with their studies and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes and lotions and clothing such as jeans, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca es una señora de 49 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora, ama de casa y agricultora, con muchos ánimos y deseos de salir adelante junto a su esposo y sus hijos 4 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen de ella y la mayor está casada y en hogar a parte. De los hijos que dependen de ella al mayor tiene una edad 15 años y el próximo año va a segundo de carrera, la segunda tiene 11 años y acaba de terminar el sexto grado y el menor de 8 años que ya el próximo año va a 4 grado. Doña Blanca tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres y una gran experiencia en el cultivo de café ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a temprana edad las diferentes técnicas cultivar café. Desde hace 15 años se dedica en compañía de su esposo al cultivo de café ya que en su familia esta actividad ha sido factor importante para el ingreso de su economía. El terreno que juntos en familia trabajan es propio es heredado por sus padres el cual está ubicado a 40 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando o en vestía. 
Sus metas y esperanzas para con su negocio es poder ampliarlo, generar mayores ganancias y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos. Como madre para sus hijos apoyarlos en sus estudios, darles la oportunidad de poder prepararse académicamente y que ellos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud por la falta de apoyo económico.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y poder asistir sus cultivos de café previniendo el deterioro por los cambios climáticos, enfermedades como la roya y bichos como la broca.
texts.en:
Blanca is 49 years old. She is hardworking, enterprising, a home maker, and a farmer. She has a great desire to get ahead in life with her husband and 4 children, of whom 3 are economically dependent on her. The oldest is married and lives apart from the family. Of the children who still depend on her, the oldest is 15 years old and next year he will go to high school. The second is 11 years old and just finished the sixth grade. The youngest one, who is 8 years old, will go to 4th grade next year. Blanca completed primary school, thanks to the moral and economic support of her parents and her experience in coffee cultivation. It was her parents who taught her from an early age about the different techniques for cultivating coffee. 

For the past 15 years, she has worked along with her husband to grow coffee since in her family this business has been an important factor for earning income. The land that the two of them work is her own, which she inherited from her parents. It is located 40 minutes away from her house. She gets there by walking or on a mule. 

Her goals and hopes for her business are to be able to expand it, earn more income, and strengthen the business for her children. As a mother, she supports her children in their studies and provides them the opportunity to prepare themselves academically so that they won’t go through the same situation she did in her youth due to a lack of economic support.

She has now requested a loan for buying agricultural inputs so that she can tend to her coffee plants and prevent deterioration from climate changes and plant illnesses such as the “la roya” [a fungal disease that attacks the plant leaves] and insect pests such as the coffee berry borer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in order to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is 19 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four older brothers, younger sister, and his parents. Two of his brothers are police officers.
